intro: Hieracium exotericum var. glevense, commonly known as the Gleven's Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species and is often found in specific ecological niches.
